# Day 729

**Try Solo Bitcoin Mining Instead Of Lottery Tickets**

Rather than wasting money on lottery tickets with infinitesimal odds of winning, consider trying your luck at solo Bitcoin mining, where through dedicated computational effort you can potentially earn bitcoin for your contribution to the network. Solo bitcoin mining embodies the pioneering spirit of the Bitcoin network, offering a unique blend of technological innovation and financial sovereignty.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*dfX-2H29Kr6GXo4UhLe3YQ.png)

Although it's often compared to playing the lottery due to the low probability of successfully mining a block alone, the comparison ends there. Solo mining transcends mere luck; it represents a fundamental contribution to the decentralization and security of the Bitcoin network by validating transactions, maintaining the blockchain, and enhancing the network's hash power, thereby reinforcing its resistance to attacks, censorship, and centralization. While the contribution of a single solo miner might seem small, if a million individuals start solo mining, it can make a real difference in the security and hash rate of the network. Remarkably, you can even purchase a [solo mining rig on Amazon for as little as $50-$100](https://amzn.to/3TJPQFJ) today, making it accessible to a wide range of individuals who wish to contribute to the decentralized ethos of Bitcoin.

<iframe src="https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?type=text%2Fhtml&key=a19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&schema=twitter&url=https%3A//twitter.com/BrianRoemmele/status/1708611115901723050%3Fs%3D20&image=" title="" height="281" width="500"></iframe>

**Maintaining Decentralized Ethos**

The essence of Bitcoin lies in its decentralized nature, which is reinforced through the participation of every miner, big or small, in the consensus process. This decentralized approach is crucial in ensuring the network's resistance to censorship and centralization, pillars that hold Bitcoin apart from traditional financial systems.

Solo mining, while a challenging endeavor due to the competitive landscape, embodies the spirit of equal opportunity within the Bitcoin ecosystem. The possibility of receiving a full block reward, currently at 6.25 bitcoins, offers a significant incentive, akin to striking gold for the digital age. This reward is not just monetary; it symbolizes the miner's contribution to securing the Bitcoin network. With the upcoming halving, the reward will diminish to 3.125 bitcoins, a testament to Bitcoin's deflationary design intended to mimic the scarcity and value preservation seen in precious metals like gold.

This scarcity principle, however, doesn't deter but rather motivates. The anticipation of reduced rewards highlights Bitcoin's intrinsic value and the importance of transaction fees as a reward for miners. As Bitcoin inches closer to its maximum supply, transaction fees in USD terms are likely to rise, ensuring that miners remain incentivized to secure the network.

The imminent halving event serves as a reminder of Bitcoin's unique economic model, a stark contrast to the inflationary policies of fiat currencies. While the reduction in block rewards poses challenges for miners, it also accentuates Bitcoin's deflationary nature, potentially leading to increased value over time. This, coupled with the anticipated rise in transaction fees, forms a balanced ecosystem where the incentives for securing the network adapt dynamically, ensuring Bitcoin's long-term viability and its position as a bulwark against the whims of centralized financial systems.

**Gamble On Things You Enjoy**

If you're a Bitcoiner than solo bitcoin mining is more than just a gamble; it's a commitment to the principles of Bitcoin. It supports network health and decentralization, provides the potential for substantial rewards, and allows individuals to engage directly with the technology that underpins Bitcoin. Solo miners not only have the chance to earn bitcoins but also contribute to the robustness and security of the network, making it an endeavor that benefits both the individual and the broader Bitcoin community.

<iframe src="https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?type=text%2Fhtml&key=a19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&schema=twitter&url=https%3A//twitter.com/NorthmanTrader/status/1770450101598572711%3Fs%3D20&image=" title="" height="281" width="500"></iframe>

Unlike in the fiat currency system where banks have the legal privilege to counterfeit money, bitcoin can only be created if someone guesses the right hash. So you might as well try your odds at hashing, even if those odds are small.

3/20/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
